name: ListPagerdutyRulesets
description:
Retrieve all PagerDuty rulesets and their details.

Use this tool to list all available rulesets in PagerDuty. Rulesets are collections of Event Rules that define actions based on event content. Note that rulesets and event rules are reaching end-of-life, and migration to Event Orchestration is recommended. OAuth with 'event_rules.read' scope is required for access.

parameters.name: api_version_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to use via the 'Accept' header. This is used for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the content type for the response. Default is 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of rulesets to be returned per page in the result set.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for pagination in the search results. Use to skip a number of entries.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total count of results in the response for pagination.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.
